title: Build-for-Rent Single-Family Communities
subtitle: A Structural Investment Opportunity | Open-Ended REIT

content.title: Build-for-Rent Single-Family Communities
content.subtitle: Open-Ended REIT | $2-3B Target Raise | ~12% Net Returns

content.title: Investment Highlights
content.takeaway: BFR combines development alpha with durable demographic demand

content.title: Investment Thesis Summary
content.takeaway: Structural affordability barriers create permanent rental demand for single-family living
bullets: 77% of U.S. households cannot afford median-priced new home—creating permanent rental demand
Purpose-built BFR communities deliver 23% rent premiums vs. scattered-site SFR
Development economics generate 150-200bp spreads (yield-on-cost vs. exit cap)
Operating efficiency: clustered communities achieve 50% lower personnel costs
Regulatory certainty: 33 states prohibit rent control; target markets landlord-friendly
Dual demographic tailwinds: millennials priced out + Boomers seeking flexibility

content.title: The Homeownership Gap
content.takeaway: Historic affordability barriers have locked out a generation of would-be buyers

content.title: Homeownership Is Structurally Broken
content.takeaway: The gap between aspiration and reality has never been wider
bullets: Median home price at 5x income vs. 3.2x in the 1990s—near historic highs
Median first-time buyer age has risen to all-time high of 38-40 years
Only 6M of 46M renter households earn $126,700+ needed to buy
Mortgage payments now 52% higher than average rents—largest gap in decades
79-80% of millennials aspire to own; only 54.9% actually do
25-percentage-point aspiration gap creates sustained demand for quality rentals

content.title: First-Time Buyer Share Has Collapsed
content.takeaway: First-time buyers have fallen from 40% historical norm to just 21-24%

content.title: Student Debt Delays Ownership by 5+ Years
content.takeaway: Debt burdens create structural barriers to accumulating down payments
bullets: 23% of millennials delayed homeownership 5+ years due to debt
Every $1,000 increase in student debt reduces ownership rates by 1.8%
Total student debt: $1.7 trillion across 45 million borrowers
Debt-burdened millennials become long-term renters by necessity
Renting single-family homes allows lifestyle without ownership burden

content.title: Rent vs. Buy Economics Favor Renting
content.takeaway: Monthly cost differential makes renting the rational economic choice

content.title: Demographic Drivers
content.subtitle: Dual Demand from Millennials and Boomers

content.title: Millennials: Renters by Necessity
content.takeaway: The largest generation wants single-family living but cannot afford to buy
bullets: Peak household formation years driving rental demand now
40% of BFR tenants have children vs. 25% in apartments
Desire for space, yards, garages—unwilling to compromise on lifestyle

content.title: Baby Boomers: Lifestyle Renters
content.takeaway: 65 million Boomers increasingly embrace rental living for flexibility
bullets: Boomers control 50% of U.S. home equity (~$17.3 trillion)
66% of those planning to move intend to downsize
Nearly 9 in 10 currently own 3+ bedroom homes
Seeking liberation from maintenance and property taxes
9 million homes projected to free up over next decade
BFR offers bridge between ownership and eventual senior living

content.title: BFR Tenant Demographics
content.takeaway: BFR attracts higher-income families seeking single-family lifestyle

content.title: Migration Patterns Concentrate Opportunity
content.takeaway: Domestic migration flows toward Sunbelt and secondary markets
bullets: Remote work accelerates migration to lower-cost markets
Population growth = housing demand = BFR opportunity

content.title: Supply Dynamics
content.subtitle: Nascent Sector with Runway for Growth

content.title: BFR Supply Remains Nascent
content.takeaway: Despite record growth, BFR represents less than 1% of SFR housing stock

content.title: BFR Completions Have Surged 455%
content.takeaway: Record deliveries still represent small fraction of housing need

content.title: Institutional SFR Is Highly Fragmented
content.takeaway: Mom-and-pop landlords still dominate—massive institutionalization opportunity
bullets: 16-17 million single-family rental units in the U.S.
Institutional ownership: only 2-3% of total SFR stock
Individual landlords own 90%+ of rental homes
Purpose-built BFR: less than 1% of SFR housing
BFR now 8-9% of single-family starts—all-time high
Rising capital costs already constraining new supply

content.title: Top Markets by BFR Pipeline
content.takeaway: Pipeline concentrated in high-growth Sunbelt metros

content.title: Priority Market Rankings
content.takeaway: Sunbelt markets offer strongest combination of growth and regulatory certainty

content.title: Phoenix-Mesa: Leading BFR Market
content.takeaway: Largest BFR inventory with sustained population and job growth
bullets: Major employers: tech, healthcare, financial services

content.title: Dallas-Fort Worth: Diversified Growth Engine
content.takeaway: Strongest population growth with diversified economic base
bullets: Corporate relocations: Toyota, Schwab, CBRE, others
No state income tax attracts migration
Strong job growth across multiple sectors

content.title: Emerging Secondary Markets
content.takeaway: Midwest markets offer lower competition and favorable fundamentals
bullets: Kansas City: Affordable land costs; growing tech presence
Smaller pipelines correlate with stronger rent growth (CBRE)
Less institutional competition than Sunbelt leaders
Attractive development economics with lower land basis

content.title: Regulatory Environment by State
content.takeaway: Target states provide maximum regulatory certainty
bullets: Texas, Florida, Arizona, Georgia: Rent control prohibited
North Carolina, Tennessee: No statewide restrictions
33 states prohibit or preempt local rent control
New construction typically exempt in regulated states

content.title: BFR Operating Performance
content.takeaway: Purpose-built communities deliver superior retention and occupancy

content.title: BFR vs. Multifamily Comparison
content.takeaway: BFR delivers 100bp+ occupancy advantage and 20pt higher retention

content.title: Why BFR Tenants Stay Longer
content.takeaway: Families with children and pets drive stickiness and stability
bullets: 40% of BFR tenants have children vs. 25% in apartments
Children = school districts = reluctance to move
65%+ are pet owners (harder to find alternative housing)
Longer stays = lower turn costs = higher NOI

content.title: SFR Rent Growth Outpaces Multifamily
content.takeaway: Single-family rents consistently grow faster than apartments

content.title: Purpose-Built Premium Over Scattered-Site
content.takeaway: Professional communities command 23% rent premium
bullets: 23% rent premium vs. scattered-site SFR (John Burns Research)
New construction quality vs. aging existing stock
Community amenities: pools, fitness, dog parks, clubhouses

content.title: Clustered Operating Efficiencies
content.takeaway: Purpose-built communities achieve 50% lower personnel costs
bullets: Personnel costs: 50% lower vs. scattered-site portfolios
On-site staff serves 100-200 homes vs. driving between sites
Standardized floor plans simplify repairs and turns
Technology integration: smart locks, remote monitoring

content.title: Major SFR/BFR Operators
content.takeaway: No public REIT focuses exclusively on purpose-built BFR

content.title: American Homes 4 Rent (AMH)
content.takeaway: Leading BFR developer but maintains mixed portfolio strategy
bullets: Q4 2024 blended rent growth: 3.3% (moderated from 5.6% Q1)

content.title: Invitation Homes (INVH)
content.takeaway: Largest public SFR REIT but focused on acquisitions, not development
bullets: Strategy: scattered-site acquisitions, not ground-up BFR
Different strategy than purpose-built community development

content.title: Differentiation Opportunity
content.takeaway: A pure-play BFR REIT addresses an underserved institutional need

content.title: Return Component Breakdown
content.takeaway: Multiple value-creation layers combine for 12% target returns

content.title: Development Economics
content.takeaway: Development spread generates 15-25% profit margin on cost
bullets: Stabilized BFR cap rates: 5.0-5.75% in primary markets
Profit margin on cost: 15-25% at stabilization
AMH development yields tracking 'just below mid-5%'
Higher yields available in secondary markets

content.title: Illustrative Per-Home Economics
content.takeaway: Conservative assumptions support 14-16% levered IRR

content.title: Financing Environment
content.takeaway: Current debt markets support development and permanent financing

content.title: Projected Portfolio Growth
content.takeaway: Deploying $2-3B over 5 years across 15,000-20,000 homes

content.title: Construction Risk
content.takeaway: Fixed-price contracts and established partners mitigate cost overruns

content.title: Interest Rate & Capital Markets
content.takeaway: Conservative leverage and staggered maturities reduce refinancing risk

bullets: Higher rates strengthen rent vs. buy

content.title: Supply & Regulatory Risk
content.takeaway: Market selection and geographic diversification provide protection

content.title: Economic Cycle Resilience
content.takeaway: SFR has demonstrated counter-cyclical demand characteristics
bullets: SFR REITs outperformed other property sectors by 23% in 2020
SFR rent growth: +3.8% YoY in Sept 2020 despite recession
Economic stress pushes households toward renting
Families with children prioritize housing stability
Essential housing need vs. discretionary spending

content.title: Tax Efficiency Advantages
content.takeaway: REIT structure provides pass-through taxation and QBI deduction
bullets: Effective top rate: 29.6% vs. 37% ordinary income
Return of capital can defer 60-90% of distributions

content.title: Open-Ended vs. Closed-Ended Structure
content.takeaway: Open-ended structure aligns with long-term BFR investment horizon

content.title: Target Distribution Profile
content.takeaway: Income orientation with growth characteristics

content.title: Why Build-for-Rent Now
content.takeaway: Structural demand meets institutional capital need for scaled BFR exposure
bullets: 77% of households cannot afford homeownership—permanent demand driver
Dual tailwinds: millennials priced out + Boomers seeking flexibility
Purpose-built BFR delivers superior operating performance
Less than 1% of SFR stock is purpose-built—massive runway
Regulatory environment favorable in target markets

content.title: Investment Summary
content.takeaway: Compelling risk-adjusted returns with structural demand backdrop

content.title: Next Steps
content.takeaway: We welcome the opportunity to discuss this investment thesis
bullets: Schedule deep-dive meeting with investment team
Review detailed financial projections and assumptions
Discuss target market analysis and pipeline
Review legal structure and subscription documents
